name: mandrake
description: Originally not native in the US, this little creature is about one foot tall with a plant taking root in it's head. It darts around wildly, scared of it's own shadow. They're usually pretending to be a fern, but this one is running about on two stubby legs. You've heard that the roots are prized for their uses in cooking.

special_attacks.monster_message: The mandrake's plant stalks harden and it suddenly reappears elsewhere.

description: Barnacles on the water's bed that are native to the Mississippi, and require particularly brackish water. The electrifying bristles make it harder to harvest the sweet, electrically-charged barnacle brine locked within.

A dark black sedge that grows in caves and other dark, moist places. It has long stems ending in tiny blue buds that seem to absorb the light around them, hiding the plant from potential predators. This makes the buds quite the commodity.

A pair of koi, one white and one black, that are cirling endlessly. They're native to the still pools of Japanese mountains, but were painstakingly transported to the Americas in the early 1900s. Their roe are a delicacy for which not even Cook himself could find the words.

A baby elk with little wooden antlers getting ready to shoot out of the top of it's head. It has a thin layer of bark all over it's body, which it shakes off on to your carpet every once in a while. Still, it gets bigger and more majestic every day.

An elk with a rack that shoots out ten feet to either side of it's head, it's entire body covered in a tangle of leaves and vines that grow and change color with the season. The sunlight filters through it's branch-like antlers and takes form, dancing in the forest around it. The creature and the grove it hosts are constantly blossoming, a thing of living beauty.

An elk with a rack that shoots out twenty feet to either side of it's head, it's entire body golden with leaves of every color. It stands nearly fifteen feet tall, and you notice a crown of gold growing atop the creature's head. This is the true king of the forest.

special_attacks.monster_message: The ascended elk sheds light and a swarm of golden butterflies radiates from their holy body!

description: A divine elk that is being used as a host for some rotten, negative energy. It's feeding on the overgrowth from the elk, turning it's once beautiful antlers black and brittle like ash. The poor creature is wild with rage, bucking wildly and attacking anything it sees in desperation. It would be a mercy to kill this thing.

A clump of dry yet flexible wood that's grown so densely around and into itself that it has taken on true life. The creature moves with arms and legs that appear and disappear from the tangle of it's body, and you recognize the points ends of wandwood branches.

name: hemor
description: Much like a long necked dog, this antennad creature moves in short, erratic bursts. It's body is composed of plates made out of a material that resembles dead wood, and they stick up like a startled cat's fur at any provocation, releasing a filthy toxic gas. A deep red glow comes from somewhere within it, and several opposable branch-like arms dangle out of it's back and whip around violently.

special_attacks.monster_message: The hemor's antennae flex and absorb energy from something!

name: Spawn Hemor
description: Stamina drain used by accursed trees

A dark black tree, it's dead branches twisted around one another, swallowing all light that touches them. It lets off a horrid toxic gas, churning the energy from the world around it into death. Some spirit or sickness has taken root in this tree, and it sways with the wind as if alive with malice. The branches at it's top are ever growing into one another, all life in the tree filtering up into one all-consuming spiral.

special_attacks.monster_message: The trees branches crack and fall away from it, taking on a life of their own.

name: Spawn accursed trees
description: Spawn accursed and drains stamina in area

A long black snakelike creature that floats through the air with no wings, a huge round mouth it's only describable feature. Red spots swirl into and out of existence on the surface of it's skin. The mouth has no teeth, instead the flesh of the creature contorts in an endless spiral, constantly hunting for something to drink.

special_attacks.monster_message: The angel's maw opens to the sky and it devours the energy from the world around it, horrid black trees sprouting as conduits of this costly drink.

name: Transforms into mutant animals
description: Transforms into mutant animals and dies

name: kills butterfly and summons mutant animals

description: A tiny golden butterfly radiating ascended light all around it. The light seems to be slowly forming a cocoon around it, and you don't imagine you'll like what comes out.

special_attacks.monster_message: The butterflies cocoon finally finishes forming and it transforms hyper-energetically into a creature of pure mutational superiority!

description: What appears to be a bright light soon shifts, revealing a central humanoid-shaped source. As you watch the shape changes from one form to another, it's mutation unending. You simply cannot imagine where all of this energy is coming from. This is the ultimate lifeform.

special_attacks.monster_message: The ascended sheds light and grows beautiful golden butterfly wings as a swarm of butterflies radiates from them.

special_attacks.description: You hear an otherworldly screaming as blood and bone come flying out of the ascended.

name: Spiral Collapse
description: Spiral mutates you, drains stamina and does damage then dies.
A spiral in the air that is either slowly growing or slowly shrinking, you can't tell. You just know that you'd hate to be around when it finishes.

special_attacks.monster_message: The spiral collapses, energy both released and absorbed.

description: Energy goes both into and out of this 'creature' in perfect harmony, freely and infinitely. Ripples form in the air around it that can only be credited as non-euclidean, impossibly powerful waves in the fabric of space. If it's altering the genetic code of the universe, who knows what it will do to a human being?

special_attacks.monster_message: The energy source ripples and spirals form in the air all around it.

description: One of an endless swarm of 'peace officers,' a unit deployed just before the Cataclysm occured. Their stated purpose was to protect and serve, but people soon realized that their hollow eyes didn't hold much sympathy. It wears the same suit and sunglasses as all the others, and wields the same FN P90.

special_attacks.description: The peace officer weaves in a shot with their p90.

description: These were the harbingers of the end, infected by a bioweapon that causes sulfur deposits to grow all over the person's body. After this disease created piles of corpses two stories tall, they rose again as zombies. This person has rapidly decayed to nearly nothing, the yellow barnacles growing inside the lacerations on it's body burning a slow death march into their tired legs. The clothes have all but rotted off the body in record time, and whatever's left of value on it is overgrown into the bramble of it's flesh.

A feral human that appears at first to be a special-ops soldier complete with night vision goggles, then you notice the insignia on their armband. One of countless private military contractors who rose up to try and form a new world in their image. The zombies seem to avoid them, and their predator eyes hunt for more lucrative prey. This pmc is feathering the hammer on a holstered pistol.

special_attacks.description: The pmc quickdraws their pistol and fires!

description: A feral human that appears at first to be a special-ops soldier complete with night vision goggles, then you notice the insignia on their armband. One of countless private military contractors who rose up to try and form a new world in their image. The zombies seem to avoid them, and their predator eyes hunt for more lucrative prey. This pmc keeps switching the firing mode on their submachine gun.

special_attacks.description: The pmc weaves in a burst with their smg!

description: A feral human that appears at first to be a special-ops soldier complete with night vision goggles, then you notice the insignia on their armband. One of countless private military contractors who rose up to try and form a new world in their image. The zombies seem to avoid them, and their predator eyes hunt for more lucrative prey. This pmc holds a shotgun over their shoulder like a sledgehammer.

special_attacks.description: The pmc lowers their shotgun and fires a blast!

description: A feral human that appears at first to be a special-ops soldier complete with night vision goggles, then you notice the insignia on their armband. One of countless private military contractors who rose up to try and form a new world in their image. The zombies seem to avoid them, and their predator eyes hunt for more lucrative prey. This pmc has a point slung rifle that they grip tightly.

special_attacks.description: The pmc goes to one knee, takes aim, and fires their rifle.

description: A feral human that appears at first to be a special-ops soldier complete with night vision goggles, then you notice the insignia on their armband. One of countless private military contractors who rose up to try and form a new world in their image. The zombies seem to avoid them, and their predator eyes hunt for more lucrative prey.

special_attacks.description: The pmc goes to one knee, takes aim, and fires their gun.

description: A private military contractor in a ghillied suit of heavy armor that almost manages to conceal their sniper rifle and the fact that they're 7 feet tall. A ballistic mask hides their expression, but you can tell they see you as easy sport.

special_attacks.description: The contract killer lets out a cool breath as they squeeze the trigger.

description: A mutated timber rattlesnake, about three times as large as the norm.  While it isn't big enough to regard humans as potential prey, it is more aggressive and dangerous compared to a normal rattler.

This strange mutant bird gains its name from its odd appearance. In the newly found Paradise, these birds have grown to five times their pre-Cataclysm ancestor's size. A murderous gleam glows in the reptilian eyes, it's beak and rooster's claws dripping with a paralyzing poison. At least somebody is doing well.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you! It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.
